content.description: Start up the ramp towards an alcove.  From the alcove make a commiting move to climb out and right.  After turning the corner continue left up the flake and onto another tricky move.
content.location: Left most route on the formation.  An obvious flake.

climbs.name: Mortarfied
climbs.fa: Todd Swain, Peggy Buckey & Bob Hostetter, March 1987

content.description:
Climb the right of three parallel cracks to it's end and then up the gritty/flakey face above passing three old 1/4" bolts.

Could stand and upgrade on the bolts and lots more traffic to help clean this thing up and gain a star. Zero stars out of five.
content.location:
Just right of

Sakreteligious

in the center of the wall.

content.description: A low crux in a right-facing corner gains a long wide crack which leans severely to the right. Could be lead with enough big cams. One star out of five.
content.location: Furthest left route on the face and left of a small tree.

content.description:
Start up utilizing the left and center of three cracks and then higher switch into the left one which is followed to it's end and a little bit of open face to the top.

Fairly dirty and junky and not especially recommended. Minus one star out of five.
content.location:
A short way right of

Trowel and Error

at triple cracks.

climbs.name: Cementary
climbs.fa: Todd Swain, Peggy Buckey & Bob Hostetter, March 1987

content.description: Start below a boulder and a tree.  Pull over the grainy boulder.  Once below the route proper head straight up the crack utilizing jamming and various other techniques.  Not as straight-forward as it might seem.  A good challenge for a 5.8 (even a 5.9) leader.
content.location: Located behind the tree at the right end of the formation.

climbs.name: Another Brick in the Wall
climbs.fa: Bob Hostetter, Peggy Buckey &Todd Swain, March 1987

content.description:
A short right-facing flake leads to open face climbing which parallels the crack to the left. Perhaps worth doing after climbing

Cementary

. One star out of five.
content.location:
Just right of

Cementary

at a flake.
